docs.snippet: LEAD: THOUGH there is tough industrial and regional resistance to be overcome on both sides of the border, high officials are ecstatic about the new United States-Canada trade agreement.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THOUGH there is tough industrial and regional resistance to be overcome on both sides of the border, high officials are ecstatic about the new United States-Canada trade agreement.

headline.main: Economic Scene; Trade Benefits For Both Sides

docs.snippet: LEAD: A Soviet Politburo member met with President Reagan today and conveyed what he called a ''very positive'' message from Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the Soviet leader, about potential progress in American-Soviet relations.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A Soviet Politburo member met with President Reagan today and conveyed what he called a ''very positive'' message from Mikhail S. Gorbachev, the Soviet leader, about potential progress in American-Soviet relations.

headline.main: Reagan Gets Message From Soviet on Better Relations

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: IN his 1975 novel ''The Autumn of the Patriarch,'' Gabriel Garcia Marquez imagined a Latin American despot so aged that he was ''older than all old men and all old animals on land or sea.'' To Latin Americans familiar with Juan Peron, Alfredo...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IN his 1975 novel ''The Autumn of the Patriarch,'' Gabriel Garcia Marquez imagined a Latin American despot so aged that he was ''older than all old men and all old animals on land or sea.'' To Latin Americans familiar with Juan Peron, Alfredo Stroessner of Paraguay or Arnulfo Arias of Panama, among others, the portrayal was less a fantasy than a deft rendering of an all-too-familiar prototype.

headline.main: For Latin America, A Greening at the Top

docs.snippet: LEAD: Amadou-Mahtar M'Bow of Senegal, whose tenure as Unesco's Director General has divided the organization, came close to winning a new six-year term today, but still fell three votes short of a majority.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Amadou-Mahtar M'Bow of Senegal, whose tenure as Unesco's Director General has divided the organization, came close to winning a new six-year term today, but still fell three votes short of a majority.

headline.main: Unesco Leader Almost Wins Enough Votes for Re-election

byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD:  Tennis  Cash Overpowers Evernden: Pat Cash of Australia overpowered Kelly Evernden of New Zealand, 6-3, 7-6, yesterday in the opening round of the Australian indoor tennis championships at the Sydney Entertainment Center. The 22-year-old...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tennis Cash Overpowers Evernden: Pat Cash of Australia overpowered Kelly Evernden of New Zealand, 6-3, 7-6, yesterday in the opening round of the Australian indoor tennis championships at the Sydney Entertainment Center. The 22-year-old Australian, who is seeded third in the event and is ranked eighth in the world, put on an impressive display of serving and volleying to beat Evernden, the winner of the Queensland Open in Brisbane last week.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Key House and Senate conferees on the trade bill, eager to send reassuring signals to Wall Street, met officially today for the first time and quickly agreed to a compromise on granting the President new trade-negotiating authority.

headline.main: Conferees in an Accord To Advance Trade Bill
